chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
base_snd: BaseParams
base_fst: BaseParams
multi_fst: MultiParams base_fst
multi_snd: MultiParams base_snd
base_map: BaseParamsPartialMap base_fst base_snd
name_map: MultiParamsNameTotalMap multi_fst multi_snd
msg_map: MultiParamsMsgPartialMap multi_fst multi_snd
name_map_bijective: MultiParamsNameTotalMapBijective name_map
multi_map_congr: MultiParamsPartialMapCongruency base_map name_map msg_map
fail_fst: FailureParams multi_fst
fail_snd: FailureParams multi_snd
fail_map_congr: FailureParamsPartialMapCongruency fail_fst fail_snd base_map
overlay_fst: NameOverlayParams multi_fst
overlay_snd: NameOverlayParams multi_snd
overlay_map_congr: NameOverlayParamsTotalMapCongruency overlay_fst overlay_snd name_map
fail_msg_fst: FailMsgParams multi_fst
fail_msg_snd: FailMsgParams multi_snd
fail_msg_map_congr: FailMsgParamsPartialMapCongruency fail_msg_fst fail_msg_snd msg_map

Goal:
forall (net net' : ordered_network) (failed failed' : list name) (tr : list (name * (input + output))), step_ordered_failure (failed, net) (failed', net') tr -> step_ordered_failure (map tot_map_name failed, pt_map_onet net) (map tot_map_name failed', pt_map_onet net') (filterMap pt_map_trace_ev tr) \/ pt_map_onet net' = pt_map_onet net /\ failed = failed' /\ filterMap pt_map_trace_ev tr = []

Premises:
pt_map_onet = fun onet : ordered_network => {| onwPackets := fun src dst : name => filterMap pt_map_msg (onwPackets onet (tot_map_name_inv src) (tot_map_name_inv dst)); onwState := fun n : name => pt_map_data (onwState onet (tot_map_name_inv n)) |} : ordered_network -> ordered_network
FailureParamsPartialMapCongruency : forall (B0 B1 : BaseParams) (P0 : MultiParams B0) (P1 : MultiParams B1), FailureParams P0 -> FailureParams P1 -> BaseParamsPartialMap B0 B1 -> Prop
Record BaseParamsPartialMap (P0 P1 : BaseParams) : Type := Build_BaseParamsPartialMap { pt_map_data : data -> data; pt_map_input : input -> option input; pt_map_output : output -> option output } Arguments Build_BaseParamsPartialMap _ _ (_ _ _)%function_scope
Record FailMsgParams (P0 : BaseParams) (P : MultiParams P0) : Type := Build_FailMsgParams { msg_fail : msg } Arguments FailMsgParams {P0} Arguments Build_FailMsgParams [P0]
Record BaseParams : Type := Build_BaseParams { data : Type; input : Type; output : Type } Arguments Build_BaseParams (_ _ _)%type_scope
pt_map_trace_ev = fun e : name * (input + output) => let (n, s) := e in match s with | inl i => match pt_map_input i with | Some i' => Some (tot_map_name n, inl i') | None => None end | inr o => match pt_map_output o with | Some o' => Some (tot_map_name n, inr o') | None => None end end : name * (input + output) -> option (name * (input + output))
NameOverlayParamsTotalMapCongruency : forall (B0 B1 : BaseParams) (P0 : MultiParams B0) (P1 : MultiParams B1), NameOverlayParams P0 -> NameOverlayParams P1 -> MultiParamsNameTotalMap P0 P1 -> Prop
filterMap = fix filterMap (A B : Type) (f : A -> option B) (l : list A) {struct l} : list B := match l with | [] => [] | x :: xs => match f x with | Some y => y :: filterMap A B f xs | None => filterMap A B f xs end end : forall A B : Type, (A -> option B) -> list A -> list B Arguments filterMap {A B}%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope
MultiParamsNameTotalMap : forall B0 B1 : BaseParams, MultiParams B0 -> MultiParams B1 -> Type
Record ordered_network (P : BaseParams) (params : MultiParams P) : Type := mkONetwork { onwPackets : name -> name -> list msg; onwState : name -> data } Arguments ordered_network {P params} Arguments mkONetwork {P params} (_ _)%function_scope
Record FailureParams (P0 : BaseParams) (P : MultiParams P0) : Type := Build_FailureParams { reboot : data -> data } Arguments FailureParams {P0} Arguments Build_FailureParams [P0] _ _%function_scope
name = fun (P : BaseParams) (MultiParams0 : MultiParams P) => let (name, msg, _, _, nodes, _, _, _, _, _) := MultiParams0 in name : forall P : BaseParams, MultiParams P -> Type Arguments name {P MultiParams}
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Record MultiParamsNameTotalMapBijective (B0 B1 : BaseParams) (P0 : MultiParams B0) (P1 : MultiParams B1) (M : MultiParamsNameTotalMap P0 P1) : Prop := Build_MultiParamsNameTotalMapBijective { tot_map_name_inv_inverse : forall n : name, tot_map_name_inv (tot_map_name n) = n; tot_map_name_inverse_inv : forall n : name, tot_map_name (tot_map_name_inv n) = n } Arguments MultiParamsNameTotalMapBijective {B0 B1 P0 P1} Arguments Build_MultiParamsNameTotalMapBijective [B0 B1 P0 P1] _ (_ _
MultiParamsPartialMapCongruency : forall (B0 B1 : BaseParams) (P0 : MultiParams B0) (P1 : MultiParams B1), BaseParamsPartialMap B0 B1 -> MultiParamsNameTotalMap P0 P1 -> MultiParamsMsgPartialMap P0 P1 -> Prop
MultiParamsMsgPartialMap : forall B0 B1 : BaseParams, MultiParams B0 -> MultiParams B1 -> Type
Inductive step_ordered_failure (P : BaseParams) (multi_params : MultiParams P) (overlay_params : NameOverlayParams multi_params) (fail_msg_params : FailMsgParams multi_params) : step_relation (list name * ordered_network) (name * (input + output)) := StepOrderedFailure_deliver : forall (net net' : ordered_network) (failed : list name) (tr : list (name * (input + output))) (m : msg) (ms : list msg) (out : list output) (d : data) (l : list (name * msg)) (from to : name), onwPackets net from to = m :: ms -> ~ In to failed -> net_handlers to from
input = fun BaseParams0 : BaseParams => let (_, input, _) := BaseParams0 in input : BaseParams -> Type Arguments input {BaseParams}
tot_map_name = fun (B0 B1 : BaseParams) (P0 : MultiParams B0) (P1 : MultiParams B1) (MultiParamsNameTotalMap0 : MultiParamsNameTotalMap P0 P1) => let (tot_map_name, _) := MultiParamsNameTotalMap0 in tot_map_name : forall (B0 B1 : BaseParams) (P0 : MultiParams B0) (P1 : MultiParams B1), MultiParamsNameTotalMap P0 P1 -> name -> name Arguments tot_map_name {B0 B1 P0 P1 MultiParamsNameTotalMap}
FailMsgParamsPartialMapCongruency : forall (B0 B1 : BaseParams) (P0 : MultiParams B0) (P1 : MultiParams B1), FailMsgParams P0 -> FailMsgParams P1 -> MultiParamsMsgPartialMap P0 P1 -> Prop
Record NameOverlayParams (P0 : BaseParams) (P : MultiParams P0) : Type := Build_NameOverlayParams { adjacent_to : Relation_Definitions.relation name; adjacent_to_dec : forall x y : name, {adjacent_to x y} + {~ adjacent_to x y}; adjacent_to_symmetric : RelationClasses.Symmetric adjacent_to; adjacent_to_irreflexive : RelationClasses.Irreflexive adjacent_to } Arguments NameOverlayParams {P0} Arguments Build_NameOverlayParams [P0] _ [adjacent_to] _%function_scope
Record MultiParams (P : BaseParams) : Type := Build_MultiParams { name : Type; msg : Type; msg_eq_dec : forall x y : msg, {x = y} + {x <> y}; name_eq_dec : forall x y : name, {x = y} + {x <> y}; nodes : list name; all_names_nodes : forall n : name, In n nodes; no_dup_nodes : NoDup nodes; init_handlers : name -> data; net_handlers : name -> name -> msg -> data -> list output * data * list (name * msg); input_handlers : name -> input -> data -> list output * data * list (name * msg) } Arguments Build_MultiParams _ [
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B

```coq
intros net net' failed failed' tr H.
inversion H; subst.
- left. apply StepOrderedFailure_deliver with (m:=m) (ms:=ms) (out:=out) (d:=d) (l:=l) (from:=from) (to:=to); auto.
- right. repeat split; auto.
Qed`
